Name: Precipitation Directory
Description: Folder containing 12 maps of monthly precipitation for each pixel
Type: Folder of 12 rasters. Units: millimeters. Raster names must end with the month number (e.g. Precip_1.tif.) Only .tif files should be in this folder (no .tfw, .xml, etc files)

Name: ET0 Directory
Description: Folder containing 12 maps of monthly reference evapotranspiration for each pixel
Type: Folder of 12 rasters. Units: millimeters. Raster names must end with the month number (e.g. ETo_1.tif) Only .tif files should be in this folder (no .tfw, .xml, etc files)

Name: Digital Elevation Model
Description: Map of elevation for each pixel
Type: Raster of integer or floating point values. Units: meters.

Name: Land-use/Land-cover
Description: Map of land use/land cover (LULC) class for each pixel. All values in this raster must have corresponding entries in the Biophysical table.
Type: Raster of integers, where each unique integer represents a different land use/land cover class

Name: Soil group
Description: Map of SCS soil hydrologic groups (A, B, C, or D), used in combination with the LULC map to compute the curve number (CN) map.
Type: Raster of integers. Values are entered as numbers 1, 2, 3, and 4, corresponding to groups A, B, C, and D, respectively.

Name: AOI/Watershed
Description: Shapefile delineating the boundary of the watershed to be modeled
Type: Shapefile (can be polyshape.) The column ws_id is required, with a unique integer value for each polygon.

Name: Biophysical table
Type: **NOTE: All LULC classes in the LULC raster MUST have corresponding values in this table.**

Name: Rain events table
Description: Table with 12 values of rain events, one per month. A rain event is defined as >0.1mm (USGS: http://drought.unl.edu/MonitoringTools/USRainDaysandDryDays.aspx)
Type: .csv (Comma Separated Value) file with column names *month* and *events*; values for month are the numbers 1 through 12, corresponding to January through December.

Name: Threshold flow accumulation
Description: The number of upstream cells that must flow into a cell before it is considered part of a stream, which is used to create streams from the DEM. Smaller values create more tributaries, larger values create fewer.

Name: alpha_m, beta_i, gamma
Description: Model parameters used for research and calibration purposes. Default values are: alpha_m = 1/12, beta_i = 1,  gamma = 1
Type: *alpha_m* is type string; *beta_i* and *gamma* are type floating point
